symbols.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/AggregationBaseDelegate
symbols.description:
Base delegate implementation for MDC Controls. This delegate serves as base implementation for aggregation-based controls, such as:

  • sap.ui.mdc.Chart
  • sap.ui.mdc.Table
  • sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar

The AggregationBaseDelegate provides an interface for aggregation based functionality by providing an array of PropertyInfo objects, which can be used during runtime for personalization through the according addItem and removeItem hooks. Additional hooks for cleanup and validation mechanisms can be implemented through this delegate.

methods.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/AggregationBaseDelegate.addItem

parameters.name: oControl
parameters.description: Instance of an sap.ui.mdc.Control. Note: The addItem hook can be used during the processing of an SAPUI5 flexibility change.

parameters.name: sPropertyName
parameters.description: The name of the property info object

parameters.name: mPropertyBag
parameters.description: Instance of property bag from SAPUI5 flexibility change API

methods.description:
Central hook to add items to the provided control instance. This method must return a promise that resolves with an instance of the implementing Control default aggregation.

Consequently the parameter mPropertyBag is only passed during preprocessing. In runtime scenarios (such as opening a personalization dialog), this method might be called without the parameter mPropertyBag.

methods.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/AggregationBaseDelegate.fetchProperties

returnValue.description: Once resolved, an array of property info objects is returned

parameters.name: oControl
parameters.description: Instance of an sap.ui.mdc.Control

methods.description:
Retrieves the relevant metadata for a given payload and returns the property info array.
By default, this method returns a Promise that resolves into [].

methods.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/AggregationBaseDelegate.onAfterXMLChangeProcessing

parameters.name: oControl
parameters.description: XML node of a mdc control

parameters.name: mPropertyBag
parameters.description: Property bag from SAPUI5 flexibility

methods.description: Hook that will be executed when changes are done applying to controls during the XML flexibility change appliance process.

methods.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/AggregationBaseDelegate.removeItem

returnValue.description: Promise resolving in a boolean, deciding whether the item should be destroyed (true) or kept (false) after removing it from the control aggregation.

parameters.name: oControl
parameters.description: Instance of a sap.ui.mdc.Control

parameters.name: oItem
parameters.description: The control instance that was removed

parameters.name: mPropertyBag
parameters.description: Instance of property bag from SAPUI5 flexibility

methods.description:
Triggers any necessary follow-up steps that need to be taken after the removal of created items via removeItem. The returned Boolean value inside the Promise can be used to prevent the default follow-up behavior of the SAPUI5 flexibility handling.
By default, this method returns a Promise that resolves into true. This will ensure, that the item will be destroyed subsequentially after it has been removed by the control.

Note: The removeItem hook can be used during the processing of an SAPUI5 flexibility change. Consequently the parameter mPropertyBag is only passed during preprocessing. In runtime scenarios (such as opening a personalization dialog), this method might be called without the parameter mPropertyBag.

symbols.title: abstract namespace sap/ui/mdc/AggregationBaseDelegate

symbols.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/BaseDelegate
symbols.description:
Basic Delegate for sap.ui.mdc.Control, sap.ui.mdc.Element

All delegate implementations for MDC controls must be derived directly or indirectly from this entity. Applications should implement getTypeMap to provide type mappings based on their model usage. Please also see the following extensible presets: sap.ui.mdc.DefaultTypeMap, sap.ui.mdc.odata.TypeMap, sap.ui.mdc.odata.v4.TypeMap

methods.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/BaseDelegate.getTypeMap

returnValue.description: typeMap configuration for this delegate Note: The returned array will also serve as a key in the weakmap-based typeutil cache of BaseDelegate

parameters.name: oControl
parameters.description: Delegate payload object

methods.description: Returns the typeutil configuration for this delegate.

symbols.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/ChartDelegate
symbols.description:
Base Delegate for Chart. Extend this object in your project to use all functionalities of the Chart.
This class provides method calls, that are called by the Chart for specific operations and overwrite the internal behavior.

parameters.name: mPropertyBag

parameters.name: sRole
parameters.description: New role for given item

methods.description:
Creates a new chart item for a given property name and updates the inner chart.
Note: This does not add the chart item to the Items aggregation of the chart. Called and used by p13n.

methods.description: The provided map is used to determine the navigation behavior of the sap.ui.mdc.chart.ChartSelectionDetails. The navigation shows a list of all entries if more than 1 entry of sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldInfoBase is given in the map. If there is only one entry, the navigation goes directly to the content of the given sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldInfoBase.

methods.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/ChartDelegate.fetchProperties

returnValue.description: Array of the property infos that is used within the chart

parameters.name: oChart
parameters.description: Reference to the chart

methods.description:
Gets the relevant PropertyInfo objects based on the metadata used with the chart instance.

Note: The result of this function must be kept stable throughout the lifecycle of your application. Any changes of the returned values might result in undesired effects.

Note: Existing properties (set via sap.ui.mdc.Chart#setPropertyInfo) must not be removed and their attributes must not be changed during the fetchProperties callback. Otherwise validation errors might occur whenever personalization-related control features (such as the opening of any personalization dialog) are activated.

methods.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/ChartDelegate.getFilterDelegate

returnValue.description: Object for the chart filter personalization

methods.description: Gets the filter delegate of the chart that provides basic filter functionality, such as adding filter fields. Note: The functionality provided in this delegate acts as a subset of a FilterBarDelegate to enable the chart for inbuilt filtering.

examples.data:
Example: Example usage of getFilterDelegate

oFilterDelegate = {
		addItem: function() {
			const oFilterFieldPromise = new Promise(...);
			return oFilterFieldPromise;
		},
		addCondition: function() {
			const oConditionPromise = new Promise(...);
			return oConditionPromise;
		},
		removeCondition: function() {
			const oConditionPromise = new Promise(...);
			return oConditionPromise;
		},
		determineValidationState: function() {
			const oValidationPromise = new Promise(...);
			return oValidationPromise;
		}
}

symbols.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/DefaultTypeMap
symbols.description:
Generic TypeMap configuration for simple use cases.

Note: The modules of all data types registered in a TypeMap must be loaded in advance.
Note: This TypeMap implementation contains the following types:

  • sap.ui.model.type.Boolean (alias Boolean)
  • sap.ui.model.type.Currency (alias Currency)
  • sap.ui.model.type.Date (alias Date)
  • sap.ui.model.type.DateTime (alias DateTime)
  • sap.ui.model.type.Float (alias Float)
  • sap.ui.model.type.Integer (alias Integer)
  • sap.ui.model.type.String (alias String)
  • sap.ui.model.type.Time (alias Time)
  • sap.ui.model.type.Unit (alias Unit)

symbols.description: Delegate for FieldBase.

methods.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/field/FieldBaseDelegate.createCondition

returnValue.description: Returns a condition object that is set on the control

parameters.name: oField
parameters.description: Field control instance

parameters.name: oControl
parameters.description: Instance of the calling control

parameters.name: aValues
parameters.description: Key and description for the condition that is created

parameters.name: oCurrentCondition
parameters.description: Currently available condition before the property change

methods.description:
Enables applications to control condition updates based on value / additionalvalue property changes.
By default, this method returns a condition with an EQ operator.

Note: Custom implementations of this method may lead to intransparency as a field's condition may then differ from the state of the value / additionalvalue properties. Avoid expensive operations, as this can delay the rendering of the output.

methods.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/field/FieldBaseDelegate.createConditionPayload

returnValue.description: Optionally returns a serializeable object to be stored in the condition payload field.

parameters.name: oField
parameters.description: Field control instance

parameters.name: oControl
parameters.description: Instance of the calling control

parameters.name: aValues
parameters.description: key, description pair for the condition which is to be created.

methods.description: Provides the possibility to convey custom data in conditions. This enables an application to enhance conditions with data relevant for combined key or out parameter scenarios.

methods.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/field/FieldBaseDelegate.createContent

returnValue.description: Array containing the created controls and the default value help, if needed

parameters.name: oField
parameters.description: Field control instance

parameters.name: sContentMode
parameters.description: A given content mode

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID of the internal control to be created.

parameters.name: bProvideDefaultValueHelp
parameters.description: If set, a default value help should be provided.

methods.description:
Provides the possibility to customize / replace the internal content of a field
By default, this method returns suitable controls for the given BaseType, maxConditions and ContentMode.

Note: Bind the value-holding property of the control to '$field>/conditions' using ConditionsType as type.

If the control needs to show multiple conditions, bind its aggregation to '$field>/conditions'. Bind the item controls value-holding property using ConditionType as type.

Warning: The returned controls must implement IFormContent. Other controls might lead to layouting or usabillity issues.

methods.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/field/FieldBaseDelegate.getAutocompleteOutput

returnValue.description: Output text or boolean true, if the autocomplete value should be accepted without modifying the visible input

parameters.name: oField
parameters.description: Field control instance

parameters.name: oCondition
parameters.description: Condition

parameters.name: sKey
parameters.description: Formatted text of the key (value)

parameters.name: sDescription
parameters.description: FormattedText of the description

parameters.name: bKeyMatch
parameters.description: If true the key matches to the user input

parameters.name: bDescriptionMatch
parameters.description: If true the description matches to the user input

methods.description:
Determines the text for the autocomplete functionality.

This function is called during a user's type-ahead into a Field, FilterField, or MultiValueField control.

The returned text will be shown as selected after the user input ends.

By default this method uses the display property of the Field, FilterField, or MultiValueField control to determine what text (key or description) is used as autocomplete-text. A text is only used if it matches the user input. If set to Value, the key is used. If set to Description, the description is used. If set to ValueDescription, the key is used, if it maps, otherwise the description. If set to DescriptionValue, the description is used, if it maps, otherwise the key.

Note: Whatever this function returns, the user input will not be overwritten, only the text after the user input will be added and shown as selected. Otherwise the cursor position might change or the user input changes while typing what would lead to confusion.
methods.code: module:sap/ui/mdc/field/FieldBaseDelegate.getAutocompleteOutput(oField, oCondition, sKey, sDescription, bKeyMatch, bDescriptionMatch) : string|boolean

methods.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/field/FieldBaseDelegate.getDescription

returnValue.description: Description for key or object containing description, key, and payload. If it is not available right away (must be requested), a Promise is returned.

parameters.name: oField
parameters.description: Field control instance

parameters.name: oValueHelp
parameters.description: Value help assigned to the Field, FilterField, or MultiValueField control

parameters.name: vKey
parameters.description: Key

parameters.name: oInParameters
parameters.description: In parameters for the key (as a key is not necessarily unique.) (Only filled in conditions of old variants.)

parameters.name: oOutParameters
parameters.description: Out parameters for the key (as a key is not necessarily unique.) (Only filled in conditions of old variants.)

parameters.name: oBindingContext
parameters.description: BindingContext of the checked field; Inside a table, the ValueHelp element might be connected to a different row.

parameters.name: oDoNotUse
parameters.description: NO LONGER USED

parameters.name: sDoNotUse
parameters.description: NO LONGER USED

parameters.name: oConditionPayload
parameters.description: Additional context information for this key

parameters.name: oControl
parameters.description: Instance of the calling control if it is not the field itself

parameters.name: oType
parameters.description: Type of the value

parameters.name: bEmptyAllowed
parameters.description: If true, the connected control could be left empty (without conditions)

throws.description: if the description cannot be determined

methods.description:
Determines the description for a given key.
By default, this method calls the getItemForValue function of the assigned ValueHelp.

This function is called while formatting the output of a Field, FilterField, or MultiValueField control if a description should be displayed but only a key is given.

If this needs to be determined asynchronously, a Promise is returned.

As the key might change (uppercase), an object with key and description can be returned.

If the description cannot be determined, a corresponding FormatException is thrown.

Determines the key, description, and payload of a user input.
By default, this method calls the getItemForValue function of the assigned ValueHelp.

If this needs to be determined asynchronously, a Promise is returned.

If the item cannot be determined, a corresponding ParseException is thrown.

returnValue.description: Index of the condition, -1 if not found

parameters.description: Value help assigned to the Field or FilterField control

parameters.name: oCondition

methods.description:
Returns the index of a condition in an array of conditions.

This function is called when a Condition is created by user input or value help selection to determine if a similar Condition already exists. This is done to prevent duplicates.

By default, if a ValueHelp exists, the ValueHelp logic is used to compare each condition. (See ValueHelpDelegate.compareConditions)

By default, this method returns conditions with an EQ operator without using the description, as it does not ensure the description is valid.

Note: Returned values can either be strings which should be parsed by the ConditionType itself or pre-created conditions.

symbols.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/odata/v4/TableDelegate
symbols.description:
Base delegate for sap.ui.mdc.Table and ODataV4. Extend this object in your project to use all functionalities of the table. For more information, please see module:sap/ui/mdc/TableDelegate.

Data aggregation is enabled if the table type is GridTable, and at least one of the following conditions is fulfilled:

  • p13nMode Group is enabled
  • p13nMode Aggregate is enabled
  • The table has group conditions
  • The table has aggregate conditions

Data aggregation can be configured via the delegate payload by providing aggregationConfiguration. See sap.ui.mdc.odata.v4.TableDelegate.Payload for details.

Sample delegate object: 

{
	name: "my/delegate/extending/sap/ui/mdc/odata/v4/TableDelegate",
	payload: {
		aggregationConfiguration: {
			leafLevel: true
		},
		...
	}
}

If data aggregation is enabled, the following restrictions apply:

  • Only properties that are technically groupable or technically aggregatable are loaded from the back end. See sap.ui.mdc.odata.v4.TableDelegate.PropertyInfo for more information about properties.
  • The path of a property must not contain a NavigationProperty.

Note: This base delegate supports the p13nMode Aggregate only if the table type is GridTable. The p13nMode Group is not supported if the table type is TreeTable. This cannot be changed in your delegate implementation.

All binding-related limitations regarding selection also apply in the context of this delegate. For details, see sap.ui.model.odata.v4.Context#setSelected and sap.ui.model.odata.v4.ODataModel#bindList.

methods.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/odata/v4/TableDelegate.fetchProperties

returnValue.description: A Promise that resolves with the property information

parameters.name: oTable
parameters.description: Instance of the table

methods.description:
Retrieves information about the relevant properties.

By default, this method returns a Promise that resolves with an empty array.

methods.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/odata/v4/TableDelegate.getInResultPropertyKeys

returnValue.description: Property keys

parameters.name: oTable
parameters.description: Instance of the table

methods.description:
Returns the keys of properties that should always be included in the result of the collection requested from the back end. This information is applied when updating the table's binding.

By default, this method returns an empty array.

Note: If properties are provided in the table's propertyInfo property, the properties whose keys are returned by this method must be included, otherwise they may not be in included the result.
The path of a property must not be empty.
If a property is complex, the properties it references are taken into account.
If autoExpandSelect of the sap.ui.model.odata.v4.ODataModel is not enabled, this method must return an empty array. See also the restrictions in the description of the TableDelegate if data aggregation is enabled.
For more information about properties, see PropertyInfo.

returnValue.description: The PropertyHelper class.

methods.description: Gets the model-specific PropertyHelper class to create an instance of.

methods.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/odata/v4/TableDelegate.updateBinding

parameters.name: oTable
parameters.description: Instance of the table

parameters.name: oBindingInfo
parameters.description: The binding info object to be used to bind the table

parameters.name: oBinding
parameters.description: The binding instance of the table that can be used to update the binding and avoid a rebind

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Additional settings

parameters.name: forceRefresh
parameters.description: Indicates that the binding has to be refreshed even if the binding info has not changed

methods.description:
Updates the binding of the table with the binding info object returned from updateBindingInfo. If an update is not possible, it rebinds the table.

Compares the current and previous state of the table to detect whether rebinding is necessary. The diffing is done for the sorters, filters, aggregation, parameters, and the path of the binding. Other binding info keys, such as events or model, must be provided in updateBindingInfo, and those keys must not be changed conditionally.

Note: To remove a binding info parameter, the value must be set to undefined in updateBindingInfo. For more information, see sap.ui.model.odata.v4.ODataListBinding#changeParameters.

References:

  • rebind

symbols.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/TableDelegate
symbols.description:
Base delegate for sap.ui.mdc.Table. Extend this object in your project to use all functionalities of the table. This base delegate already meets some requirements of certain features. Others need to be met by your delegate implementation.

The following methods need to be added or overridden in your delegate. Please also see the documentation of the methods to learn about their default implementation and what you need to implement.

  • Basic prerequisites
    • fetchProperties
    • updateBindingInfo
  • Column personalization (related to p13nMode Column)
    • addItem
    • Filter personalization (related to p13nMode Filter)
      • getFilterDelegate

    Note: This base delegate does not support the p13nMode Aggregate, and the p13nMode Group is only supported if the table type is ResponsiveTable. This cannot be changed in your delegate implementation.

methods.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/TableDelegate.addItem

returnValue.description: A Promise that resolves with a column

parameters.name: oTable
parameters.description: Instance of the table or an XML node representing the table during preprocessing

parameters.name: sPropertyKey
parameters.description: The property key

parameters.name: mPropertyBag
parameters.description: Instance of a property bag from the SAPUI5 flexibility API

methods.description:
Central hook that is called to add columns to the table when the state is applied, for example, when SAPUI5 flexibility changes are applied. During preprocessing, this method is called without the mPropertyBag parameter, and oTable is an XML node.

By default, this method does not create a column and just returns a Promise that resolves without a value.

methods.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/TableDelegate.fetchExpandAndCollapseConfiguration

returnValue.description: A Promise that resolves with an object containing the expand and collapse functions

parameters.name: oTable
parameters.description: Table instance

methods.description:
Returns the feature set for expanding or collapsing nodes in the table.

By default, this method returns an empty object.

To enable specific functionalities, the configuration must contain the following functions:

  • To enable Expand Entire Tree, the expandAll function needs to be implemented.
  • To enable Collapse Entire Tree, the collapseAll function needs to be implemented.
  • To enable Expand Entire Node, the expandAllFromNode and isNodeExpanded functions need to be implemented.
  • To enable Collapse Entire Node, the collapseAllFromNode and isNodeExpanded functions need to be implemented.

Note: Expand and collapse all from a specific node is only supported if the table rows are selectable.

examples.data:
Example: 

TableDelegate.fetchExpandAndCollapseConfiguration = function(oTable) {
		return Promise.resolve({
			expandAll: function(oTable) {
				// Implement expandAll functionality
			},
			collapseAll: function(oTable) {
				// Implement collapseAll functionality
			}
		});
}

methods.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/TableDelegate.fetchExportCapabilities

returnValue.description: A Promise that resolves with an object as specified in sap.ui.export.ExportHandler

parameters.name: oTable
parameters.description: Instance of the table

methods.description:
Returns the feature set for exporting data in the table.

By default, this method returns basic sap.ui.export.FileType.XLSX capabilities.

methods.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/TableDelegate.fetchProperties

returnValue.description: A Promise that resolves with the property information

parameters.name: oTable
parameters.description: Instance of the table

methods.description:
Retrieves information about the relevant properties.

By default, this method returns a Promise that resolves with an empty array.

Note:

  • The result of this function must be kept stable throughout the lifecycle of your application. Any changes of the returned values might result in undesired effects.
  • Existing properties (set via sap.ui.mdc.Table#setPropertyInfo) must not be removed and their attributes must not be changed during the fetchProperties callback. Otherwise validation errors might occur whenever personalization-related control features (such as the opening of any personalization dialog) are activated.

methods.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/TableDelegate.getFilterDelegate

returnValue.description: Object for the tables filter personalization

methods.description: Returns the filter delegate of the table that provides basic filter functionality, such as adding filter fields.

examples.data:
Example: 

oFilterDelegate = {
		addItem: function() {
			const oFilterFieldPromise = new Promise(...);
			return oFilterFieldPromise;
		},
		addCondition: function() {
			const oConditionPromise = new Promise(...);
			return oConditionPromise;
		},
		removeCondition: function() {
			const oConditionPromise = new Promise(...);
			return oConditionPromise;
		},
		determineValidationState: function() {
			const oValidationPromise = new Promise(...);
			return oValidationPromise;
		}
}

Returns filters to be applied when updating the table's binding based on the filter conditions of the table itself and its associated IFilterSource.

By default, filters for the associated filter source are only generated for a sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar.

By default, filters and sorters are added to the binding info. Please see getFilters, getSorters, and getGroupSorter for more details.

parameters.description: ValueHelp content instance

parameters.name: oConfig

methods.description:
Provides an object of conditions per binding path.
By default, this method returns an empty object.

This method provides the initial set of conditions applied every time value help content is shown for the first time after opening its container. It is also relevant for getItemForValue scenarios that allow you to find a specific value help item (indicated by the availability of the oConfig argument).

methods.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/ValueHelpDelegate.getFilters

returnValue.description: Array of filters

parameters.name: oValueHelp
parameters.description: The ValueHelp control instance

parameters.name: oContent
parameters.description: ValueHelp content requesting conditions configuration

methods.description:
Returns filters that are used when updating the binding of the ValueHelp.
By default, this method returns a set of Filters originating from an available FilterBar, the delegate's own getFilterConditions, and/or the filterFields configuration of the given FilterableListContent.

methods.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/ValueHelpDelegate.getFirstMatch

returnValue.description: Promise resolving in the Context that's relevant'

parameters.name: oValueHelp
parameters.description: The ValueHelp control instance

parameters.name: oContent
parameters.description: ValueHelp content instance

parameters.name: oConfig
parameters.description: Configuration

methods.description:
Returns the content that is used for the autocomplete feature and for user input, if the entered text leads to more than one filter result.

By default, this method searches and returns an entry from a set of relevant contexts of the given ListContent.

To determine which columns are relevant for the search, the currently active displayMode Display of the connected control will be used. While a Value configuration will lead to a 'key'-only search, DescriptionValue leads to searching the description first and the key afterwards. Other modes work the same way.

For each relevant column all items are searched for an exact match first and again with a startsWith filter afterwards, if necessary.

If the caseSensitive property is disabled, whichever entry comes first, wins, whether the user's input is in lowercase or uppercase letters.

ListContent

parameters.name: oContainer
parameters.description: Container instance

parameters.description: ID of the content shown after this call to retrieve content

methods.description:
Requests additional content for the value help.

This method is called during the opening phase of a ValueHelp, if a new content is displayed for a CollectiveSearch dialog or if one of the following methods is called: getItemForValue, requestShowTypeahead, requestShowValueHelp

So depending on the value help Content used, all content controls and data need to be assigned. Once they are assigned and the data is set, the returned Promise needs to be resolved. Only then does the value help continue opening or reading data.
By default, this method returns a Promise that resolves into undefined.

All delegate implementations for MDC controls must be derived directly or indirectly from this entity. Applications should implement getTypeMap to provide type mappings based on their model usage. Please also see the following extensible presets: sap.ui.mdc.DefaultTypeMap, sap.ui.mdc.odata.TypeMap, sap.ui.mdc.odata.v4.TypeMap

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.Chart
symbols.description:
The Chart control creates a chart based on metadata and the configuration specified.

Note: The Chart control acts as a wrapper that is used to enhance an instance of a given chart control framework (in the following texts referred to as inner chart) with functionalities, such as a toolbar, p13n, and VariantManagement. The inner chart instance and its configuration must be provided via an implementation of a ChartDelegate module.

Documentation links:

  • Chart Building Block (OData V4)

properties.name: autoBindOnInit
properties.description:
If set to true, the chart is automatically bound after initialization.
If set to false, the chart is bound after the first call to rebind.

properties.name: chartType
properties.description: Specifies the type of chart to be created by the Chart control.

properties.name: delegate
properties.description:
Object related to the Delegate module that provides the required APIs to execute model-specific logic.
The object has the following properties:

  • name defines the path to the Delegate module
  • payload (optional) defines application-specific information that can be used in the given delegate
Sample delegate object: 
{
	name: "sap/ui/mdc/BaseDelegate",
	payload: {}
}
Note: Ensure that the related file can be requested (any required library has to be loaded before that).
Do not bind or modify the module. This property can only be configured during control initialization.

properties.name: filterConditions
properties.description:
Defines the filter conditions.
Note: This property must not be bound.
Note: This property is exclusively used for handling SAPUI5 flexibility changes. Do not use it for anything else.

Since: 1.99.

properties.name: header
properties.description: Specifies header text that is shown in the chart.

properties.name: headerLevel
properties.description:
Semantic level of the header.
For more information, see sap.m.Title#setLevel.

Since: 1.104.

properties.name: headerStyle
properties.description:
Defines style of the header. For more information, see sap.m.Title#setTitleStyle.

Since: 1.120.

properties.name: headerVisible
properties.description:
Determines whether the header text is shown in the chart. Regardless of its value, the given header text is used to label the chart correctly for accessibility purposes.

Since: 1.111.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Defines the height of the chart.

properties.name: ignoreToolbarActions
properties.description:
Specifies which actions must not be available in the chart's toolbar.

Since: 1.88.

properties.name: legendVisible
properties.description:
Enables the legend of the chart.
Note: The setter calls setLegendVisible of the delegate class.

Since: 1.88.

properties.name: minHeight
properties.description: Defines the minimum height of the chart.

properties.name: minWidth
properties.description: Defines the minimum width of the chart.

properties.name: noDataText
properties.description:
Defines the no data text shown in the chart.

Since: 1.88.

properties.name: p13nMode
properties.description:
Specifies the personalization options available for the chart.
Note: The order of the provided options does not influence the arrangement of the icons on the UI.

Since: 1.88.

properties.name: propertyInfo
properties.description:
Specifies the chart metadata.
Note: This property must not be bound.
Note: This property is exclusively used for handling SAPUI5 flexibility changes. Do not use it otherwise.
Note: Existing properties (set via sap.ui.mdc.Chart#setPropertyInfo) must not be removed and their attributes must not be changed during the fetchProperties callback. Otherwise validation errors might occur whenever personalization-related control features (such as the opening of any personalization dialog) are activated. Note: For more information about the supported inner elements, see PropertyInfo.

Since: 1.99.

properties.name: showChartTooltip
properties.description:
Controls the visibility of the chart tooltip.
Note: If set to true, a call of the delegate.setChartTooltipVisibility is triggered and can be used to make the Chart tooltip visible.

Since: 1.88.

properties.name: showSelectionDetails
properties.description: Enables the Details button in the chart toolbar.

properties.name: sortConditions
properties.description:
Defines the sort conditions.
Note: This property must not be bound.
Note: This property is exclusively used for handling SAPUI5 flexibility changes. Do not use it for anything else.

Since: 1.88.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Defines the width of the chart.

aggregations.name: actions
aggregations.description:
This aggregation describes actions that are added to the chart toolbar.
For more information, see sap.ui.mdc.actiontoolbar.ActionToolbarAction.

Note: This aggregation is managed by the control, can only be populated during the definition in the XML view, and is not bindable. Any changes of the initial aggregation content might result in undesired effects. Changes of the aggregation have to be made with the StateUtil.

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description:
This property describes the measures and dimensions visible in the chart. Changes in the personalization are also reflected here.

Note: This aggregation is managed by the control, can only be populated during the definition in the XML view, and is not bindable. Any changes of the initial aggregation content might result in undesired effects. Changes of the aggregation have to be made with the StateUtil.

aggregations.name: noData
aggregations.description:
Defines the custom visualization if there is no data available.
This control will be displayed on top of the chart when no data is visible inside the chart.
Note: If both a noDataText property and a noData aggregation are provided, the noData aggregation takes priority.
If the noData aggregation is undefined or set to null, the noDataText property is used instead.

Since: 1.107.

aggregations.name: selectionDetailsActions
aggregations.description:
Feeds details popover actions for data point selection in the chart.
For more information, see SelectionDetailsActions.

aggregations.name: variant
aggregations.description: Reference to a sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement control for the chart.

associations.name: filter
associations.description:
Control or object that enables the chart to do filtering, such as sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar. See also sap.ui.mdc.IFilter.

Automatic filter generation only works in combination with a sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar.

Since: 1.88.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.name: initialized

returnValue.description: Promise that resolves once MDC chart is initialized. Contains reference to MDC chart

methods.description: Checks whether the chart is initialized. After initialization the delegate is loaded and (in case of autoBindOnInit=true) the inner chart is created. The inner chart is not bound yet. Use innerChartBound for it.

methods.name: innerChartBound

returnValue.description: Promise that resolves once MDC chart is bound

methods.description: Can be used to check whether the inner chart is initialized and bound.

methods.name: rebind

returnValue.description: A Promise that resolves after rebind is executed, and rejects if rebind cannot be executed, for example because there are invalid filters.

methods.description: Executes a rebind considering the provided external and inbuilt filtering.

methods.name: setAutoBindOnInit

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bAutoBindOnInit
parameters.description: New value for property autoBindOnInit

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property autoBindOnInit.

If set to true, the chart is automatically bound after initialization.
If set to false, the chart is bound after the first call to rebind.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is true.

methods.name: setDelegate

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oDelegate
parameters.description: New value for property delegate

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property delegate.

Object related to the Delegate module that provides the required APIs to execute model-specific logic.
The object has the following properties:

  • name defines the path to the Delegate module
  • payload (optional) defines application-specific information that can be used in the given delegate
Sample delegate object: 
{
	name: "sap/ui/mdc/BaseDelegate",
	payload: {}
}
Note: Ensure that the related file can be requested (any required library has to be loaded before that).
Do not bind or modify the module. This property can only be configured during control initialization.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is ...see text or source.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.chart.ChartImplementationContainer
symbols.description: The ChartImplementationContainer creates a container for the content (chart) and noDataContent. Based on the showNoDataStruct the content or noDataContent will be shown.

properties.name: showNoDataStruct
properties.description: Toggles the visibility of the noDataContent & content

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description: Content/Chart to be visualized.

aggregations.name: noDataContent
aggregations.description:
Control that is shown when there is no data available inside the chart.
This can be used if the standard behavior of the used chart control needs to be overriden.
To show this noDataContent, set showNoDataStruct.

associations.description:
Association to noData content set in the chart.
If set, this will be used instead of the noDataContent aggregation.

symbols.description: The ChartSelectionDetails control creates a sap.m.SelectionDetails popover based on metadata and the configuration specified.

properties.name: enableNavCallback
properties.description:
Callback function that is called for each SelectionDetailsItem to determine if the navigation is enabled. The callback is called with the following parameters:

  • oSelectionDetails sap.ui.mdc.chart.ChartSelectionDetails: Instance of this ChartSelectionDetails
  • oContext sap.ui.model.Context: Binding context of the SelectionDetailsItem
The return value of the callback has to be of type boolean.

Since: 1.126.

properties.name: fetchFieldInfosCallback
properties.description:
Callback function that is called to determine navigation targets when clicking on a SelectionDetailsItem. The callback is called with the following parameters:

  • oSelectionDetails sap.ui.mdc.chart.ChartSelectionDetails: Instance of this ChartSelectionDetails
  • oContext sap.ui.model.Context: Binding context of the SelectionDetailsItem
The return value of the callback has to be of type Promise resolving in a Map containing a string as key and a sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldInfoBase as value.

Since: 1.126.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.chart.PropertyInfo
symbols.description:
An object literal describing a data property in the context of a sap.ui.mdc.Chart.

When specifying the PropertyInfo objects in the propertyInfo property, the following attributes need to be specified:

  • key
  • label
  • groupable
  • aggregatable
  • role
  • dataType

properties.name: groupable
properties.description: Defines whether the property is groupable and is selectable as a dimension in the chart

properties.name: aggregatable
properties.description: Defines whether the property is aggregatable and is selectable as a measure in the chart

properties.name: role
properties.description: Defines the role that the property visualizes inside the chart

methods.description:
Creates a condition instance for a condition representing a item chosen from the value help.

This is a "equal to" (EQ) condition with key and description. It is used for entries selected in the field help and for everything entered in the Field control.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionObject
symbols.description: Condition object type defining the structure of a condition.

properties.name: operator
properties.description: Operator of the condition. The standard operators can are mentioned in OperatorName.

properties.name: values
properties.description: Array of values of the condition. Depending on the operator, this contains one or more entries. The entries are stored in an internal format regarding the used data type.

properties.name: inParameters
properties.description: In parameters of the condition. For each field path, a value is stored. (It is obsolete and only filled for conditions stored on old user-variants.)

properties.name: outParameters
properties.description: Out parameters of the condition. For each field path, a value is stored. (It is obsolete and only filled for conditions stored on old user-variants.)

properties.name: isEmpty
properties.description: If set, the condition is empty (used as initially empty condition in Conditions)

properties.name: validated
properties.description: If set to ConditionValidated.Validated, the condition is validated (by the value help) and not shown in the Conditions content

properties.name: payload
properties.description: Payload of the condition. Set by application. Data needs to be stringified. (as stored and loaded in variants)

symbols.title: namespace sap.ui.mdc.condition.FilterOperatorUtil

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.condition.Operator
symbols.description:
Creates an sap.ui.mdc.condition.Operator object. This is used in the FilterField control to define which filter operators are supported.

If a function or property is initial, the default implementation is used.

parameters.name: oConfiguration
parameters.description: Properties of the operator

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the operator used in the condition

parameters.name: alias
parameters.description:
Alias names based on BaseType, used to map to DynamicDateOption if DynamicDateRange is used to visualize the filter
For example, if an operator must use the DATE option if used for a date type and the DATETIME option if used for a date/time type, the alias needs to be configured as {Date: "DATE", DateTime: "DATETIME"}.

parameters.name: filterOperator
parameters.description: The operator's default filter operator that is created as defined in FilterOperator

parameters.name: tokenParse
parameters.description: The string representation of the regular expression that is used by the operator to parse a value to eliminate the operator and get the data string. A placeholder that refers to the translated tokenText can be used. #tokenText# refers to the oConfiguration.tokenText property if given.

parameters.name: tokenTest
parameters.description:
The string representation of the regular expression that is used to test if the given text meets the operator. A placeholder that refers to the translated tokenText can be used. #tokenText# refers to the oConfiguration.tokenText property if given.
If not provided, the tokenParse regular expression is used.

parameters.name: tokenFormat
parameters.description: The string representation that is used by the operator to format a value into an output string. For the value placeholder {0} and {1} are used. A placeholder that refers to the translated tokenText can be used. #tokenText# refers to the oConfiguration.tokenText property if given.

parameters.name: valueTypes
parameters.description:
Array of type to be used. The length of the array defines the number of values that need to be entered with the operator.
If set to OperatorValueType.Self, the Type of the Field or FilterField using the Operator is used.
If set to OperatorValueType.SelfNoParse same as OperatorValueType.Self, except that the input value parsing will not be called.
If set to OperatorValueType.Static, a simple string type is used to display static text.
If set to a name of a data type, an instance of this data type is used.
If set to an object with structure sap.ui.mdc.condition.ValueType, an instance of the corresponding data type is used. The type given via name must be loaded by the application.
If set to null, the corresponding value is interpreted as a description that holds no required data. To display this value, the additional Type of the Field or FilterField using the Operator is used.

parameters.name: paramTypes
parameters.description: Array of type parameters regexp

parameters.name: longText
parameters.description:
String representation of the operator as a long text.
This text is shown in the operator dropdown of the value help.
If longText is not given , the tokenText is used, replacing the placeholders "{0}" and "{1}" with "X" and "Y".

parameters.name: tokenText
parameters.description:
String representation of the operator as a short text.
This text is only needed if there any language dependent text should be shown on the token, like "Next 5 days". (In this case #tokenText# is used in tokenFormat, tokenTest, or tokenParse.) For operators just showing the value and a operator symbol, no token text is needed.
If the token text is not given, the longText is used. If tokenTextForTypes is provided for a special type, it will be used for that.

parameters.name: tokenTextForTypes
parameters.description:
Object holding string representation of the operator as a token text for single basic types.
This text is shown as text in a single-value field or as token in a multi-value field.
This is needed if the text depends on the data type used. For example, the "equal" operator should be named "Not Specified (empty)" if a date or time type is used.

parameters.name: longTextForTypes
parameters.description:
Object holding String representation of the operator as a long text for single basic types.
This text is shown in the operator dropdown of the value help.
This is needed if the text depends on the used data type. For example the "less than" operator should be named "before" if a date or time type is used.

parameters.name: displayFormats
parameters.description: Pattern how different displayFormats are rendered

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Function to format condition

parameters.name: parse
parameters.description: Function to parse input into condition

parameters.name: validate
parameters.description: Function to validate condition

parameters.name: getModelFilter
parameters.description: Function create filter for a condition

parameters.name: isEmpty
parameters.description: Function to check if condition is empty

parameters.name: createControl
parameters.description: Function to create a control to be used in Conditions

parameters.name: getCheckValue
parameters.description: Function to get the value for condition compare

parameters.name: getValues
parameters.description: Function to get the real values without operator symbol

parameters.name: checkValidated
parameters.description: Function to check if a condition is validated (sets the validated property)

parameters.name: exclude
parameters.description: If set, the operator is handled as exclude filter when creating the filters of all conditions

parameters.name: validateInput
parameters.description: If set, the user input for this operator needs to be validated using a value help

parameters.name: additionalInfo
parameters.description: additionalInfo text for the operator. Will be shown in the operator suggest as second column. If not used (undefined) the Include or Exclude information of the operator is used.

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: Additional group settings for the operator. Will be used by the DynamicDateRange. If not used (undefined), the operators will be added to the include and exclude groups.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description:
Group ID for the operator. The following groups are available for the DynamicDateRange control:

  • 1 - Single Dates
  • 2 - Date Ranges
  • 3 - Weeks
  • 4 - Months
  • 5 - Quarters
  • 6 - Years
See DynamicDateRangeGroups.
This only works for FilterFields with custom operators if maxConditions=1 and no valueHelp is assigned to the FilterField. Example:
group: undefined - if group is not specified; default behavior include/exclude group with id 1 and 2 will be created
group: {id : 1} - adds the operator to existing group 1 'Single Dates'
group: {id : 2, text: "new group"} - inserts a new group with id 2. Existing group 2 will be shifted to 3, 4....
group: {id : 10, text: "new group at the end"} - adds a new group with id 10 and text "new group as the end" to the end of all groups
Note: The ids 900-999 are reserved for internal mdc usage, please use only IDs outside of this range.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Group title for the operator. When used a new group with this title will be added.

parameters.name: groupsForTypes
parameters.description: Additional group settings for the operator depending on the type. For every type, a group object can be defined.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.Control
symbols.description: The base class for controls in the sap.ui.mdc library providing delegate-related functionality (see sap.ui.mdc.mixin.DelegateMixin).

properties.name: delegate
properties.description:
Object related to the Delegate module that provides the required APIs to execute model-specific logic.
The object has the following properties:

  • name defines the path to the Delegate module
  • payload (optional) defines application-specific information that can be used in the given delegate
Sample delegate object: 
{
	name: "sap/ui/mdc/BaseDelegate",
	payload: {}
}
Note: Ensure that the related file can be requested (any required library has to be loaded before that).
Do not bind or modify the module. This property can only be configured during control initialization.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: Optional ID for the new control; generated automatically if no non-empty ID is given Note: This can be omitted, no matter whether mSettings is given.

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Object with initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Creates and initializes a new control with the given sId and settings.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.Element
symbols.description: The base class for composite elements in the sap.ui.mdc library providing delegate-related functionality (see sap.ui.mdc.mixin.DelegateMixin).

properties.name: delegate
properties.description:
Object related to the Delegate module that provides the required APIs to execute model-specific logic.
The object has the following properties:

  • name defines the path to the Delegate module
  • payload (optional) defines application-specific information that can be used in the given delegate
Sample delegate object: 
{
	name: "sap/ui/mdc/BaseDelegate",
	payload: {}
}
Note: Ensure that the related file can be requested (any required library has to be loaded before that).
Do not bind or modify the module. This property can only be configured during control initialization.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: Optional ID for the new element; generated automatically if no non-empty ID is given Note: This can be omitted, no matter whether mSettings is given.

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Object with initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Creates and initializes a new element with the given sId and settings.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.name: awaitControlDelegate

returnValue.description: Returns a Promise reflecting the delegate initialization

throws.description: Throws an error if the delegate module is not available

methods.description: Provides access to the delegate initialization Promise. Note: initControlDelegate must be called to start the delegate initialization

methods.name: awaitPropertyHelper

returnValue.description: Returns a Promise that resolves with the property helper

methods.description: Provides access to the property helper initialization Promise.

methods.name: sap.ui.mdc.Element.extend

returnValue.description: Created class / constructor function

parameters.name: sClassName
parameters.description: Name of the class being created

parameters.name: oClassInfo
parameters.description: Object literal with information about the class

parameters.name: FNMetaImpl
parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

methods.description:
Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.mdc.Element with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo.

oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in sap.ui.core.Element.extend.

methods.name: finalizePropertyHelper

returnValue.description: Returns a Promise that resolves with the property helper

parameters.name: aProperties
parameters.description: optional set of initial properties

parameters.name: bFinal
parameters.description: flag for mark the propertyHelper as final

methods.description: Finalize the propertyHelper using the control's delegate.

methods.name: getControlDelegate

returnValue.description: typeUtil made available by a delegate module

throws.description: Throws an error if the delegate module is not available

methods.description: Returns the delegate instance, if available.

nodes.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.ConditionValidated
nodes.description:
Enumeration of the validated state of conditions

If a Condition is chosen from a field help or validated against a field help it is set to be validated. In this case the corresponding item in the value help is shown as selected.

If the validated state of the Condition is undefined this means it is not defined if it is validated or not.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.FieldDisplay
symbols.description:
Defines the output of a Field, FilterField, or MultiValueField control.

For the Field control, this enumeration defines how the value and additionalValue properties are formatted.

For the MultiValueField control, this enumeration defines how the key and description properties of the items are formatted.

For the FilterField control, this enumeration defines how key and description of equal conditions are formatted.

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.FieldDisplay.Description
properties.description: Only the description is displayed

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.FieldDisplay.DescriptionValue
properties.description: The description and the value (key) are displayed in the field. The value (key) is displayed after the description in brackets.

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.FieldDisplay.Value
properties.description: Only the value (key) is displayed

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.FieldDisplay.ValueDescription
properties.description: The value (key) and the description are displayed in the field. The description is displayed after the value (key) in brackets.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.enums.FieldDisplay
symbols.description:
Defines the output of a Field, FilterField, or MultiValueField control.

For the Field control, this enumeration defines how the value and additionalValue properties are formatted.

For the MultiValueField control, this enumeration defines how the key and description properties of the items are formatted.

For the FilterField control, this enumeration defines how key and description of equal conditions are formatted.

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enums.FieldDisplay.Description
properties.description: Only the description is displayed

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enums.FieldDisplay.DescriptionValue
properties.description: The description and the value (key) are displayed in the field. The value (key) is displayed after the description in brackets.

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enums.FieldDisplay.Value
properties.description: Only the value (key) is displayed

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enums.FieldDisplay.ValueDescription
properties.description: The value (key) and the description are displayed in the field. The description is displayed after the value (key) in brackets.

symbols.title: enum sap.ui.mdc.enums.FieldDisplay

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.enums.FieldEditMode

properties.description: Field, FilterField or MultiValueField is rendered in disabled mode

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enums.FieldEditMode.Display
properties.description: Field, FilterField or MultiValueField is rendered in display mode

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enums.FieldEditMode.Editable
properties.description: Field, FilterField or MultiValueField is rendered in editable mode

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enums.FieldEditMode.EditableDisplay
properties.description: If more than one control is rendered by the Field, FilterField or MultiValueField control, the first part is editable, and the other parts are in display mode.

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enums.FieldEditMode.EditableReadOnly
properties.description: If more than one control is rendered by the Field, FilterField or MultiValueField control, the first part is editable, and the other parts are read-only.

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enums.FieldEditMode.ReadOnly
properties.description: Field, FilterField or MultiValueField is rendered in read-only mode

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.enums.OperatorName
symbols.description: Collects the operators that are included in the library.

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enums.OperatorName.BT
properties.description:
"between" operator

There is no validation if the first value is less than the second value as the comparison would be type-dependent and cannot be performed in a generic way.

The operator is available for string, numeric, date, time, and date/time types.

If a DynamicDateRange control is used for the output, the operator is mapped to the DATERANGE option if a date type is used and to the DATETIMERANGE option if a date/time type is used.

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enums.OperatorName.Contains
properties.description:
"contains" operator

The operator is available for string types.

properties.description:
"empty" operator

The operator is available for string, date, and date/time types.

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enums.OperatorName.EndsWith
properties.description:
"ends with" operator

The operator is available for string types.

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enums.OperatorName.EQ
properties.description:
"equal to" operator

Depending on the used DisplayFormat, the key, the description, or both are used as output of formatting and during parsing.

The operator is available for all data types.

If a DynamicDateRange control is used for the output, the operator is mapped to the DATE option if a date type is used and to the DATETIME option if a date/time type is used.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.Field
symbols.description:
The Field control is used to bind its value to data of a certain data type. Based on the data type settings, a default control is rendered by the Field as follows:

  • In display mode, usually a Text control is rendered.
  • If multipleLines is set, an ExpandableText control is rendered.
  • If fieldInfo is set and it is configured to be triggerable, a Link control is rendered. The multipleLines property is forwarded to the wrapping property of the Link control.
  • In edit mode, usually an Input control is rendered.
  • If multipleLines is set, a TextArea control is rendered.
  • If a date type is used, a DatePicker control is rendered.
  • If a date/time type is used, a DateTimePicker control is rendered.
  • If a time type is used, a TimePicker control is rendered.
  • If a currency or unit type is used, two Input controls are rendered, one for number and one for unit.


Documentation links:
  • Field Building Block (OData V4)

properties.name: additionalValue
properties.description:
The additional value of the field.

To display the key and the description in one field, the description must be set on the additionalValue property.

properties.name: value
properties.description:
The value of the field.

To display the key and the description in one field, the key must be set on the value property.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new Field.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: change

parameters.name: value
parameters.description:
The new value of the Field.

If a ValueHelp is assigned to the Field, the value is used as key for the ValueHelp items.

parameters.name: valid
parameters.description:
Flag that indicates if the entered value is valid.

This flag is only set if the user input is parsed and validated synchronously. If there is some asynchronous parsing or validation, for example, via request to a back-end system, the validation result will be returned in the promise parameter.

parameters.name: promise
parameters.description:
Returns a Promise for the change. The Promise returns the value if it is resolved. If the change event is synchronous, the Promise has already been already resolved. If it is asynchronous, it will be resolved after the value has been updated. If the user input is not valid, the Promise will be rejected with the corresponding exception.

The Field should be set to busy during the parsing to prevent user input. As there might be a whole group of fields that needs to be busy, this cannot be done automatically.

Since: 1.69.0.

events.description:
This event is fired when the value property of the field is changed by user interaction.

Note This event is only triggered if the used content control has a change event.

methods.name: attachChange

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.mdc.Field itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the change event of this sap.ui.mdc.Field.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.mdc.Field itself.

This event is fired when the value property of the field is changed by user interaction.

Note This event is only triggered if the used content control has a change event.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionsType
symbols.description: This class represents a type that is used to map an array of conditions to a single-value control (such as Input or Text control).

parameters.name: oFormatOptions
parameters.description: Formatting options

parameters.name: valueType
parameters.description: Type of the value of the condition (used for formatting, parsing and validating)

parameters.name: additionalValueType
parameters.description: Type of the additionalValue (description) of the condition (used for formatting, parsing, and validating)

parameters.name: operators
parameters.description: Possible operators to be used in the condition

parameters.name: display
parameters.description: DisplayFormat used to visualize a value

parameters.name: valueHelpID
parameters.description: ID of the value help to determine the key and description

parameters.name: hideOperator
parameters.description: If set, only the value of the condition is shown, but no operator. (Use it only if just one operator is supported.)

parameters.name: maxConditions
parameters.description: Maximum number of allowed conditions

parameters.name: bindingContext
parameters.description: BindingContext of field. Used to get a key or description from the value help using in/out parameters. (In a table, the value help might be connected to a different row)

parameters.name: originalDateType
parameters.description: Type used on field, for example, for date types; a different type is used internally to have different formatOptions

parameters.name: additionalType
parameters.description: Additional type used for another part of a field (for example, for unit fields)

parameters.name: compositeTypes
parameters.description: Additional types used for each part of a CompositeType (if valueType is a CompositeType)

parameters.name: additionalCompositeTypes
parameters.description: Additional types used for each part of a CompositeType (if additionalValueType is a CompositeType)

parameters.name: getConditions
parameters.description: Function to get the existing conditions of the field.

parameters.name: asyncParsing
parameters.description: Callback function to tell the Field the parsing is asynchronous.

parameters.name: navigateCondition
parameters.description: Condition of keyboard navigation. If this is filled, no real parsing is needed as the condition has already been determined and is just returned

parameters.name: delegate
parameters.description: Field delegate to handle model-specific logic

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: Payload of the delegate

parameters.name: preventGetDescription
parameters.description: If set, description is not read by formatValue as it is known that no description exists or might be set later

parameters.name: defaultOperatorName
parameters.description: Name of the default Operator

parameters.name: convertWhitespaces
parameters.description: If set, whitespaces will be replaced by special characters to display whitespaces in HTML

parameters.name: control
parameters.description: Instance of the calling control

parameters.name: noFormatting
parameters.description: If set, the conditions will not be formatted (MultiInput value property case)

parameters.name: keepValue
parameters.description: If noFormatting is set, this value is used as output to keep the typed value during value help selection

parameters.name: multipleLines
parameters.description: If set, the input and output might contain multiple lines

parameters.name: emptyAllowed
parameters.description: If true, the connected control could be left empty (without conditions)

parameters.name: oConstraints
parameters.description: Value constraints

constructor.description: Constructor for a Conditions type.

methods.name: _parseValueToIndex

returnValue.description: The array of conditions or a Promise resolving with the array of conditions. If there is no value, null is returned.

parameters.name: vValue
parameters.description: The value that is parsed

parameters.name: sSourceType
parameters.description: The type of the given value; see Allowed Property Types In addition to the standard source types, sap.ui.mdc.raw can be used. In this case the value is not parsed and just used in the condition. If the value of the condition is an array representing data for a CompositeType, the index of the needed raw value can be added to the name (For example, if a unit should be forwarded as raw value sap.ui.mdc.raw:1 can be used).

parameters.name: iIndex
parameters.description: Index where new conditions should be inserted, if -1 they will just be added

throws.description: If parsing to the model type is not possible; the message of the exception is language-dependent as it may be displayed on the UI

methods.description: Parses an external value of the given source type to an array of conditions that holds the value in model representation. These values are parsed using the given data type. Depending on the operator and the configuration (set in FormatOptions) a value will be determined by given value help or delegate.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.
