symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.table.ComplexPropertyInfo
symbols.description:
An object literal that describes attributes of a complex data property in the context of an sap.ui.mdc.Table. A complex property references other properties in the propertyInfos attribute.

If a sap.ui.mdc.table.Column points to a complex property via its propertyKey property, the table considers all the referenced properties as visible in the column. All referenced properties are taken into account for certain features, for example, for the column width calculation.

Some attributes of the referenced properties can be overridden. If, for example, exportSettings are specified for the complex property, the export settings of the referenced properties are ignored. This can be used to provide a different formatting template, for example.

properties.name: exportSettings
properties.description: The export settings. Set to null to prevent this property from being exported.

properties.name: clipboardSettings
properties.description: The clipboard settings. Set to null to prevent this property from being copied to clipboard.

properties.name: template
properties.description: Defines the formatting template that supports indexed placeholders for referenced properties within curly brackets, for example, "{0} ({1})".

properties.name: visualSettings
properties.description: This object contains all relevant attributes for visual adjustments.

properties.name: widthCalculation
properties.description: Settings for column width calculation. Set to null to disable the automatic column width calculation for this property.

properties.name: minWidth
properties.description: The minimum content width in rem

properties.name: maxWidth
properties.description: The maximum content width in rem

properties.name: defaultWidth
properties.description: The default column content width when type check fails

properties.name: gap
properties.description: The additional content width in rem

properties.name: includeLabel
properties.description: Whether the label is taken into account

properties.name: truncateLabel
properties.description: Whether the label is truncated

properties.name: verticalArrangement
properties.description: Whether the referenced properties are arranged vertically

properties.name: excludeProperties
properties.description: A list of invisible referenced property keys

symbols.title: typedef sap.ui.mdc.table.ComplexPropertyInfo

properties.name: draggable
properties.description:
Determines whether the rows of the table are draggable.

Note: Setting this property to true may expose the rows of the table in other DropInfo event parameters. In this case, only the binding context of the row is allowed to be used. Internal controls and their types are subject to change without notice.

symbols.description: The table type info class for the metadata-driven table.

properties.name: enableColumnFreeze
properties.description:
Determines whether the number of fixed columns is configurable via the column menu.

Since: 1.136.

properties.name: fixedColumnCount
properties.description: Defines the number of fixed columns.

properties.name: rowCount
properties.description: Row count of the inner table. This property specifies the minimum row count if sap.ui.mdc.enums.TableRowCountMode.Auto is used. This property specifies the row count if sap.ui.mdc.enums.TableRowCountMode.Interactive or sap.ui.mdc.enums.TableRowCountMode.Fixed is used.

properties.name: rowCountMode
properties.description: Defines how the table handles the row count.

properties.name: scrollThreshold
properties.description:
Number of records to be requested from the model when the user scrolls through the table.

The property defines how many additional (not yet visible) data records from the back-end system are pre-fetched during scrolling. If the scrollThreshold is lower than the number of visible rows, the number of visible rows is used as the scrollThreshold. If the value is 0, thresholding is disabled.

Note: This property only takes effect if it is set to a positive integer value. Otherwise the threshold property is used.

Since: 1.128.

properties.name: selectionLimit
properties.description:
Number of indices which can be selected in a range. Accepts positive integer values. If set to 0, the selection limit is disabled, and the Select All checkbox appears instead of the Deselect All button.

Note: To avoid severe performance problems, the limit should only be set to 0 in the following cases:

  • With client-side models
  • With server-side models if they are used in client mode
  • If the entity set is small

In other cases, we recommend to set the limit to at least double the value of the threshold property of the table.

properties.name: showHeaderSelector
properties.description: Determines whether the header selector is shown.

parameters.description: Optional ID for the new object; generated automatically if no non-empty ID is given

properties.description: This object contains all relevant properties for visual adjustments.

properties.description: Settings for column width calculation. Set to null to disable the automatic column width calculation for this property.

properties.description: The minimum content width in rem

properties.description: The default column content width when type check fails

properties.description: The additional content width in rem

properties.description: Whether the label is taken into account

properties.description: Whether the label is truncated

properties.description: Whether the referenced properties are arranged vertically

properties.name: excludeProperties
properties.description: A list of invisible referenced property keys

properties.name: importance
properties.description:
Defines the column importance.

Columns are moved to the pop-in area in the following order:

  • With importance High: moved last
  • With importance Medium or None: moved second
  • With importance Low: moved first


Since: 1.110.

properties.name: mergeFunction
properties.description:
Defines the control serialization function to merge duplicate cells into one cell block. This function is used to compare values of two cells.

Note: Don't set this property for cells for which the content provides a user interaction, such as sap.m.Link.

Since: 1.110.

properties.name: detailsButtonSetting
properties.description:
Defines which columns are hidden instead of moved into the pop-in area depending on their importance. See sap.ui.mdc.table.ResponsiveColumnSettings#getImportance for more details.

Note: To hide columns based on their importance, it's mandatory to set showDetailsButton to true.
If no importance is given, a device-dependent default configuration is used.
If this property is changed after the table has been initialized, the new changes take effect only when the Show / Hide Details button is pressed a second time.

Since: 1.86.

properties.name: growingMode
properties.description: Specifies the growing mode.

properties.name: popinLayout
properties.description:
Defines the layout in which the table pop-in rows are rendered.

Since: 1.96.

properties.name: showDetailsButton
properties.description:
Specifies whether the Show / Hide Details button is shown.

If the available screen space gets too narrow, the columns configured with High and Medium importance move to the pop-in area, while the columns with Low importance are hidden.
On mobile phones, the columns with Medium importance are also hidden.
As soon as the first column is hidden, this button appears in the table toolbar and gives the user the possibility to toggle the visibility of the hidden columns in the pop-in area.

Since: 1.79.

Icon for the row action item.

Note: A custom icon cannot be set when the table type is ResponsiveTable.

Text for the row action item.

Note: A custom text cannot be set when the table type is ResponsiveTable.

Setting the type ensures default values for the properties icon and text. If an icon or text is set explicitly, this setting is used.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.table.RowSettings
symbols.description: The RowSettings control is used to configure a row. This control can only be used in the context of the sap.ui.mdc.Table control to define row settings.

properties.name: highlight
properties.description:
The highlight state of the rows.

If the highlight is set to MessageType.None (default), no highlights are visible. Valid values for the highlight property are values of the enumerations module:sap/ui/core/message/MessageType or sap.ui.core.IndicationColor (only values of Indication01 to Indication10 are supported for accessibility contrast reasons).

Accessibility support is provided with the highlightText property. If the highlight property is set to a value of module:sap/ui/core/message/MessageType, the highlightText property does not need to be set because a default text is used. However, the default text can be overridden by setting the highlightText property. In all other cases the highlightText property must be set.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.util.PromiseCache
symbols.description: Provides a caching mechanism for promises. This API features Promise cancellation: resolve or reject handlers won't be called after removal of the promise, cache destruction or manual cancellation. Destroying the cache will cancel all registered promises and delete references. Convenience methods for promise creation, wrapping and replacement are offered.

methods.name: add

returnValue.description: Returns the newly created Promise

parameters.name: sName
parameters.description: Promise identifier

parameters.name: fnCreate
parameters.description: creation method or pre-created promise

methods.description:
Adds a promise to the promise cache using a string identifier and a creation method or given Promise. Calling add using an already existing identifier will cancel and replace the existing promise.

Note: All unsettled promises will be cancelled on removal or cache destruction A given creation method will receive the following arguments on execution:

  • oPromise - The newly created Promise
  • fnResolve - Resolve method for the newly created Promise
  • fnReject - Reject method for the newly created Promise
  • fnRemove - Remove method for the newly created Promise

methods.name: cancel

returnValue.description: Returns the canceled Promise

parameters.name: vPromise
parameters.description: Promise or identifier

methods.description: Cancels an unsettled promise from the promise cache. Calling cancel twice is a no-op.

methods.name: clear
methods.description: Provides cleanup functionality for the promise cache

methods.name: destroy
methods.description: Provides cleanup functionality for the promise cache

methods.name: sap.ui.mdc.util.PromiseCache.extend

returnValue.description: Created class / constructor function

parameters.name: sClassName
parameters.description: Name of the class being created

parameters.name: oClassInfo
parameters.description: Object literal with information about the class

parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

methods.description:
Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.mdc.util.PromiseCache with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo.

properties.name: maxConditions
properties.description:
Defines the maximum number of filter conditions for the property. Possible values that can be used:

  • 1 is a single-filter expression field
  • -1 is a multi-filter expression field
This information is, for example, used in the addItem method of the FilterBar control to forward this information to the created FilterField instance.

properties.name: caseSensitive
properties.description: Whether filtering by this property is case-sensitive

symbols.title: typedef sap.ui.mdc.util.PropertyInfo

properties.name: key
properties.description: Unique, stable key for the property. It must only contain characters allowed for IDs, see sap.ui.core.ID. Does not have to be an existing attribute in the data model or the technical name of an attribute in the data model.

properties.name: label
properties.description: Translatable text that labels the property

properties.name: tooltip
properties.description: Translatable text that can optionally be offered as tooltip, for example, in a personalization dialog

properties.name: visible
properties.description: Whether the property is or can be visible to a user

properties.name: group
properties.description: Key of the group in which the property is located. Used to visually group properties in personalization dialogs.

properties.name: groupLabel
properties.description: Translatable text of the group.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.ValueHelp
symbols.description: The ValueHelp element can be assigned to the Field, MultiValueField, and FilterField controls using the valueHelp association. One ValueHelp element instance can be assigned to multiple fields (like in different table rows). It should be placed in the control tree on the container holding the fields.

properties.name: _config
properties.description: internal configuration

properties.name: _valid
properties.description: Internal property to allow to bind the valid state to OK Button or make it available for all content controls

properties.name: conditions
properties.description:
The conditions of the selected items.

Note: This property must only be set by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

Note: A condition must have the structure of ConditionObject.

properties.name: delegate
properties.description:
Object related to the Delegate module that provides the required APIs to execute model-specific logic.
The object has the following properties:

  • name defines the path to the Delegate module. The used delegate module must inherit from ValueHelpDelegate
  • payload (optional) defines application-specific information that can be used in the given delegate
Sample delegate object: 
{
	name: "sap/ui/mdc/ValueHelpDelegate",
	payload: {}
}
Note: Ensure that the related file can be requested (any required library has to be loaded before that).
Do not bind or modify the module. This property can only be configured during control initialization.

properties.name: filterValue
properties.description:
The value by which the help is filtered. Here the field provides the typed value to allow the value help to filter for it.

Note: This only takes effect if the ValueHelp elements content supports filtering.

Note: This property must only be set by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

properties.name: validateInput
properties.description:
If this property is set, the user input of the corresponding field is validated against the value help. If no entry is found for the user input, an error is shown on the field.

If this property is not set, the user input is still checked against the value help. But if no entry is found, the user input is set to the field if the used data type allows this. (A type parsing error is shown if the user input adheres to the requirements of the used data type.)

Note: The input is validated and compared against the content assigned to the typeahead aggregation. If no content is assigned to the typeahead aggregation, the input is not validated.

aggregations.name: dialog
aggregations.description: Container that is used and opened if the value help icon of the input field is pressed.

aggregations.name: typeahead
aggregations.description: Container that is used and opened in typeahead

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new element, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new element

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new ValueHelp.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.description:
Gets current value of property delegate.

Object related to the Delegate module that provides the required APIs to execute model-specific logic.
The object has the following properties:

  • name defines the path to the Delegate module. The used delegate module must inherit from ValueHelpDelegate
  • payload (optional) defines application-specific information that can be used in the given delegate
Sample delegate object: 
{
	name: "sap/ui/mdc/ValueHelpDelegate",
	payload: {}
}
Note: Ensure that the related file can be requested (any required library has to be loaded before that).
Do not bind or modify the module. This property can only be configured during control initialization.

Default value is ...see text or source.

methods.name: getValidateInput

returnValue.description: Value of property validateInput

methods.description:
Gets current value of property validateInput.

If this property is set, the user input of the corresponding field is validated against the value help. If no entry is found for the user input, an error is shown on the field.

If this property is not set, the user input is still checked against the value help. But if no entry is found, the user input is set to the field if the used data type allows this. (A type parsing error is shown if the user input adheres to the requirements of the used data type.)

Note: The input is validated and compared against the content assigned to the typeahead aggregation. If no content is assigned to the typeahead aggregation, the input is not validated.

Default value is true.

methods.name: isFocusInHelp

returnValue.description: if true, focus goes to the value help, if false it stays in the calling control.

returnValue.description: If true, the navigation should be enabled if value help is closed

parameters.name: iStep
parameters.description: Number of steps for navigation (e.g. 1 means next item, -1 means previous item)

methods.description:
Determines if navigation via arrow keys should be possible.

In ComboBox-like case keyboard-navigation should be anabled if closed and if open. If only typeahead is used (and maybe an value help dialog) keyboard-navigation schould be enabled only if typeahed is open.

As not all rowas might be loaded navigation with home, end, page up or dowm might be disabled, depending of the used content.

methods.name: retrieveDelegateContent

returnValue.description: Promise that is resolved if all content is available

parameters.name: oContainer
parameters.description: Container instance

parameters.name: sContentId
parameters.description: ID of the content shown after this call to retrieve content

methods.description:
Retrieves delegate-based content modifications.

This method may be called during the ValueHelp's opening phase, whenever a new content should be displayed for a CollectiveSearch dialog configuration or when one of #getItemForValue, #requestShowTypeahead or #requestShowValueHelp are called.

So depending on the value help Content used, all content controls and the relevant data need to be assigned. Once they are assigned and the data is set, the returned Promise needs to be resolved. Only then does the value help continue opening or reading data.
This method returns a Promise that resolves into undefined.

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new Container.

This is the basis for various value help containers. It cannot be used directly.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

Determines if navigation via arrow keys should be possible.

In ComboBox-like case keyboard-navigation should be anabled if closed and if open. If only typeahead is used (and maybe an value help dialog) keyboard-navigation schould be enabled only if typeahed is open.

As not all rowas might be loaded navigation with home, end, page up or dowm might be disabled, depending of the used content.

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new Content.

This is the basis for various types of value help content. It cannot be used directly.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: visualFocusSet

This event is fired if the visual focus is set to the value help.

In this case the visual focus needs to be removed from the opening field, but the real focus must stay there.

Since: 1.127.0.

In ComboBox-like case keyboard-navigation should be anabled if closed and if open. If only typeahead is used (and maybe an value help dialog) keyboard-navigation schould be enabled only if typeahed is open.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.DefineConditionPanel
symbols.description: A DefineConditionPanel control is used inside the ValueHelp content to enter different types of conditions.

properties.description:
Internal configuration

Note: This property must not be set from outside, it used to forward the configuration of the ValueHelp

Since: 1.115.0.

properties.description:
If set, there has been no invalid user input.

Note: This property must not be set from outside. It is a property because that way it can be bound to the ManagedObjectModel of the calling value help and automatically update it.

associations.name: fieldHelp
associations.description:
Optional FieldHelp.

This is an association that allows the usage of one ValueHelp instance for the value fields for the DefineConditionPanel. Note: The fields are single-value input, and the display is always set to FieldDisplay.Value. Only a ValueHelp with a TypeAhead and single-selection MTable can be used. Note: For Boolean, Date, or Time, no FieldHelp should be added, but a default ValueHelp used instead.
Deprecated as of version 1.114.0. replaced by valueHelp association

associations.name: valueHelp
associations.description:
Optional ValueHelp.

This is an association that allows the usage of one ValueHelp instance for the value fields for the DefineConditionPanel.

Note: The fields are single-value input, and the display is always set to FieldDisplay.Value. Only a ValueHelp with a TypeAhead and single-selection MTable can be used.

Note: For Boolean, Date, or Time, no ValueHelp should be added, but a default ValueHelp used instead.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.FilterableListContent
symbols.description: Content for the Container element.

properties.name: descriptionPath
properties.description: The path of the description field in the content binding. If a table is used as content, this is the binding path of the description of the items.

properties.name: filterFields
properties.description:
The fields based on which the table data is filtered. For filtering, the value of the filterValue property is used.

If set to $search, and if the used binding supports search requests, a $search request is used for filtering.

If set to one or more properties, the filters for these properties are used for filtering. These filters are set on the ListBinding used. The properties need to be separated by commas and enclosed by "*" characters. ("*Property1,Property2*")

If it is empty, no suggestion is available.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.120.2. replaced by isSearchSupported

properties.name: group
properties.description:
If set, all contents with the same group are arranged together on one tab.

The label of the groups can be defined on the container via setGroupConfig.

properties.name: keyPath
properties.description: The path of the key field in the content binding. If a table is used as content, this is the binding path of the key of the items.

properties.name: caseSensitive
properties.description:
If this property is set to true, the filtering for user input is always case-sensitive. Otherwise user input is checked case-insensitively. If $search is used, this property has no effect on the $search request.

If the used back-end service supports a case-insensitive search, set this property to false.

properties.name: useAsValueHelp
properties.description: If set, the list is opened whenever the value help icon is pressed.

properties.name: useFirstMatch
properties.description:
If set, getItemForValue returns the first item that matches the text.

In the default implementation, this is the first item that matches the entered text. Which item is used can be determined by implementing getFirstMatch.

The matching item is returned in the typeaheadSuggested event and used for the autocomplete feature in the connected field.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new element, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new element

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new ListContent.

This is the basis for various types of value help list content. It cannot be used directly.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.content.Conditions
symbols.description: Content for the Container element showing a condition panel.

properties.name: label
properties.description: Label shown on condition panel.

associations.name: fieldHelp
associations.description:
Optional FieldHelp.

This is an association that allows the usage of one FieldHelp instance for the value fields for the Conditions.

Note: The value fields on the conditions UI cannot be accessed from outside. The fields are single-value input, and the display is always set to FieldDisplay.Value. Only a ValueHelp with a TypeAhead and a single-selection MTable can be used.

Note: For Boolean, Date, or Time types, no FieldHelp should be added, but a default FieldHelp used instead.
Deprecated as of version 1.114.0. replaced by valueHelp association

associations.name: valueHelp
associations.description:
Optional ValueHelp.

This is an association that allows the usage of one ValueHelp instance for the value fields for the Conditions.

Note: The value fields on the conditions UI cannot be accessed from outside. The fields are single-value input, and the display is always set to FieldDisplay.Value. Only a ValueHelp with a TypeAhead and a single-selection MTable can be used.

Note: For Boolean, Date, or Time types, no ValueHelp should be added, but a default ValueHelp used instead.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.content.FixedList
symbols.description: Content for the Container element showing a list with fixed values.

properties.name: emptyText
properties.description:
If set, an item to clear the selection is added.

This item is only available if the connected field can be cleared.

Since: 1.138.

properties.name: filterList
properties.description:
If set, the items of the list are filtered based on filterValue.

If a type-ahead behavior for the connected field is wanted, this property must be set to true. For small lists, all values are meant to be shown, independent of the typing in the connected field. In this case this property must be set to false.

By default, if not set, the list opens if the user clicks into the connected field.

Note: if restrictedToFixedValues is set, filtering should be disabled.

properties.name: groupable
properties.description: If set, the items of the list can be grouped

properties.name: restrictedToFixedValues
properties.description:
If set, the connected field must not allow other values than the items of the FixedList. Free text must be avoided.

By default, if set, the list opens if the user clicks into the connected field.

Since: 1.138.

aggregations.name: _emptyItem
aggregations.description:
Item for empty value (no Conditions)

Since: 1.138.

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description:
Items of the value help.

The key of the items is not shown in the list, but is used as a value of the connected field.

If the additionalText for all the items is not used, the column will not be displayed.

Note: Icons are currently not supported.

symbols.description: Container for the ValueHelp element showing a dialog.

properties.name: groupConfig
properties.description:
Configuration for groups (collective search).

The object needs to contain an entry for every possible group. The labels of every group need to have a structure of sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.content.GroupLabel. If no configuration is provided a standard text "search and select" is used.

Sample: 

{
group1: {label: "Label 1 ({0})", nnLabel: "Label 1"},
group2: {label: "Label 2 ({0})", nnLabel: "Label 2"}
}

symbols.title: class sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.Dialog

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.FilterBar
symbols.description:
The FilterBar control is used to display filter properties in a user-friendly manner to populate values for a query. The filters are arranged in a logical row that is divided depending on the space available and the width of the filters. The Go button triggers the search event, and the Show Filters button shows the additional filter field.
The FilterBar control creates and handles the filters based on the provided metadata information. The metadata information is provided via the FilterBarDelegate implementation. This implementation has to be provided by the application.
Note: The FilterBar can only be used for a Dialog and not on its own.

properties.name: delegate
properties.description:
Object related to the Delegate module that provides the required APIs to execute model-specific logic.
The object has the following properties:

  • name defines the path to the Delegate module
  • payload (optional) defines application-specific information that can be used in the given delegate
Sample delegate object: 
{
	name: "sap/ui/valuehelp/FilterBarDelegate",
	payload: {}
}
Note: Ensure that the related file can be requested (any required library has to be loaded before that).
Do not bind or modify the module. This property can only be configured during control initialization.

properties.name: expandFilterFields
properties.description: Determines whether the Show/Hide Filters button is in the state show or hide.

properties.name: filterFieldThreshold
properties.description: Number of FilterItems which will be shown via Show Filters.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new FilterBar for a value help dialog.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

parameters.description: New value for property delegate

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property delegate.

Object related to the Delegate module that provides the required APIs to execute model-specific logic.
The object has the following properties:

  • name defines the path to the Delegate module
  • payload (optional) defines application-specific information that can be used in the given delegate
Sample delegate object: 
{
	name: "sap/ui/valuehelp/FilterBarDelegate",
	payload: {}
}
Note: Ensure that the related file can be requested (any required library has to be loaded before that).
Do not bind or modify the module. This property can only be configured during control initialization.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is ...see text or source.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.Popover
symbols.description: Container for the ValueHelp element showing a popover.

properties.name: opensOnClick
properties.description:
Controls the possibility to open this popover container by clicking on a connected control, even if no content enforces it.

Note: By default, a type-ahead is only shown to provide suggestions when users enter input in a connected control. This property enables scenarios where popovers need to be shown earlier (for example, recommendations or recently entered values). See also showTypeahead

Since: 1.110.0.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.121.0. replaced by shouldOpenOnClick

properties.name: opensOnFocus
properties.description:
Controls the possibility to open this popover container by focussing on a connected control.

Note: By default, a type-ahead is only shown to provide suggestions when users enter input in a connected control. This property enables scenarios where popovers need to be shown earlier (for example, recommendations or recently entered values). See also showTypeahead

Since: 1.112.0.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.121.0. replaced by shouldOpenOnFocus

Constructor for a new Popover container.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.
